text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly addresses the requirement of the criterion. Under Section I.A.1, it states: 'Under the New York Convention (which binds US, Germany, and UK): ... Courts must refer disputes to arbitration unless the clause is \"null and void, inoperative, or incapable of being performed\"' and further notes, 'Your position: If the Germans sue in German courts, your client should immediately move to stay/dismiss based on the arbitration agreement.' This directly covers the requirement to identify that courts must stay or dismiss actions when a matter is subject to an arbitration agreement, referencing the New York Convention and the practical application in German courts.", "criterion_id": "9a18bff1-0b8a-437e-b610-22df6d1367a6"}
